channel.title: [Android] AppBak
channel.description:
This is the first android application I've written:
http://android.moparisthebest.org/index.php/apps/appbak
Much thanks to Unhandled for the icon.
Anyone with an android phone give me some feedback.

item.title: [Android] AppBak
item.dc:creator: @Imperative Imperative
item.description:
@Imperative wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:12, topic:345842”][quote author=Imperative link=topic=442223.msg3612873#msg3612873 date=1306730292]
Wait, I read that the core was programmed in C, Java was just for the UI. Are you sure it’s not just based off of Java?
And also, how could I develop Android on Ubuntu? Done it on Windows, not sure how on Ubuntu…
[/quote]
Android apps are written in Java. The ‘core’ is the Linux kernel, which is written in C and Assembly. Since development of android apps can be done in Eclipse with the JDK, you do it the same way on Ubuntu that you did in windows.[/quote]

Oh, thanks, Mopar

Read full topic

item.title: [Android] AppBak
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Imperative, post:11, topic:345842”]Wait, I read that the core was programmed in C, Java was just for the UI. Are you sure it’s not just based off of Java?
And also, how could I develop Android on Ubuntu? Done it on Windows, not sure how on Ubuntu…[/quote]
Android apps are written in Java. The ‘core’ is the Linux kernel, which is written in C and Assembly. Since development of android apps can be done in Eclipse with the JDK, you do it the same way on Ubuntu that you did in windows.

Read full topic

item.title: [Android] AppBak
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:345842”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=442223.msg3281683#msg3281683 date=1279923372]
Fast question, as this is the issue with many of the programs I find. Does the app have a set height and width? I have been patching Android for my phone, so it has problems when the height and width is set.
[/quote]

Mine doesn’t. I didn’t think any android application did, every one I’ve seen are set to just use the available height and width.[/quote]
Its the same thing i thought, but for example, the HTC Hero home replacement, doesn’t show with the correct height and width, so that’s my theory, but I’ve been to lazy to unpack the apk file, and see for myself. I’ll check out you app though

Read full topic

CoonHunter:

Fast question, as this is the issue with many of the programs I find. Does the app have a set height and width? I have been patching Android for my phone, so it has problems when the height and width is set.

Mine doesn’t. I didn’t think any android application did, every one I’ve seen are set to just use the available height and width.

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Version 1.0 is released, I believe I’m done with this app unless someone suggests something else to add to it. It does what I set out to do.

item.title: [Android] AppBak
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:3, topic:345842”]great!

what do you use to develop android apps? iPhone is objective c and is shit.[/quote]

Eclipse with the android dev plugin. It works great, automated building, packaging, signing and all.

edit: but yes, as Teh Spede said android apps are written in Java. Though you can write native components as well, if you have to.

Read full topic
